title: TA, Math Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem (Jerusalem, Jerusalem)
Interview Descriptions: they wanted to know whats my grade and personal interview with a proffesor from the faculty, it was a good experience. i recommnd anyone who want to continue to maters to do it
Interview Questions: why you want to be a TA

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem (Tel Aviv-Yafo)
Interview Descriptions: In person, interview was conducted. The presentation of previous work was done. Then writing the statement of purpose about the project. The understanding about the research project is usually asked. and if you are interested in the research project is also enquired.
Interview Questions: How would you biofortify the grapes with vitamin C?

title: Lab Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem
Interview Descriptions: I met HR and the principal investigator of the lab. I was interviewed for a position to manage their zebra fish colony. Unlike every other bio job I interviewed for there was no discussion of the science in the lab which was a red flag.
Interview Questions: Am I very punctual all most all of the time.

title: Publications Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem (Jerusalem, Jerusalem)
Interview Descriptions: A first interview with the hiring manager and maybe someone else from the department. A second interview is with a committee that includes university HR, a union rep, a department rep. May also be up against people applying internally.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for the job? Where do you see yourself in 5/10 years time?

title: Backend Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem
Interview Descriptions:
Met with lab responsable.
Non technical questions only grades required. Explained thé project goals and expectations. Very kind person. Job was in a lab search with no other computer peopke so interviewer made sûre i will be capable to Copé with any kind of issues
Interview Questions: Why do you want thé job?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem
Interview Descriptions: personal questions, statistical questions , interview face to face. probability questions. one step. only questions. programming questions, personal questions, statistical questions , interview face to face. probability questions. one step. only questions. programming questions.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem
Interview Descriptions: The job was posted on a website that was easy to use and understand.  The entire process was positive.  The interview was professional and courteous. Best of luck to everyone

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem
Interview Descriptions:
1. Sending CV to the relevant department
2. Interview with the relevant professor in whose course you want to practice
3. submitting score sheet & examination
4. HR interview and offer

The process was agile and easy, most of it depending on future availability and the score sheet
Interview Questions: What is your past experience in teaching / tutoring?

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem
Interview Descriptions: 2 parts. You have a 1:1 interview with the head of social life department and then a group interview. The 1:1 interview is to see how well you can get along and gel with those in the department, as well as to see your experience. The second interview has you running a program for others in the group interview +more.
Interview Questions: How would you bring the different populations of the program together?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview, discussion on my PhD project. Discussion on the project I might carry in hebrew University of Jerusalem . Discussion about my date of join, how long will I continue, about family status, future plans.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem (Jerusalem, Jerusalem)
Interview Descriptions: Was asked about future plans in academia, willingness to engage with graduate students, check papers, availability to meet in person with students,etc. In addition, if I would be willing to give a few classes and offer my own subjects to the syllabus
Interview Questions:
What are you most passionate about in academic learning?
How can you help a student who has writing difficulties?
How are your computer and internet skills?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview, usual questions about past experience, weaknesses and strengths, questions about how i would face different kind of situations. Also questions about my English abilities and experience with people abroad.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem (Jerusalem, Jerusalem) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I went to my advisor office he asked me about my grades and how will i be helpful to the lab. afterwards I send my advisor a mail asking when can i start. the process of filling out the forms takes about an hour and you need to take a laser safety test plus a lab working test, the tests are online.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem (Jerusalem, Jerusalem) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
You just need to be graduated student.
Every stdent is getting hired, even talented 3rd year undergraduated students.
The secretary called me and ask if I want to be a grader, and descibe to me the job.
Interview Questions: Are you intersting in the position.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem (Jerusalem, Jerusalem) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: I encountered an ad posted on one of the university walls looking for a research assistant. I emailed the professor my CV, and was scheduled an interview. The interview was short and businesslike - the professor was just looking for a part-time assistant with certain skills, which i had. I started working about a week after the interview.
Interview Questions: I did not encounter any difficult or unexpected questions.

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem (Jerusalem, Jerusalem) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: went in to ask if they need new people and was told to send my CV via email. did that and after a week or so got a telephone call asking mw to come in for an interview. was asked general questions- what i study, if i have another job and was explaind about the job and the hours. very nice interview, made me feel welcomed.

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem (Jerusalem, Jerusalem) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: First you have to find a lab to do your thesis in. from there its different for each lab. After the PI interviews you, there is a committee to assess that you are capable to do a PhD and that the project makes sense.
Interview Questions: Basically, the PI will present the projects and maybe will give you few papers to read. The questions focus is both on the papers and on general knowledge.  Personal status is usually important because your PI will want you to give all your time to the research.
